description: Auto-responses are way to make Wynem respond to triggers in regular messages. A member will send a message in the server, and if the message meets the criteria of one of the auto-responses, Wynem will reply to that message with a customisable response.

reply.name: Ewan
reply.message: Where can I download the pack?

buttons.label: All resource pack downloads can be found here

description: The triggers are the things that must be inside a members message in order for Wynem to respond. There are 4 different types of trigger that you can use:

rows: Will only match if the entire message is the same as the trigger
Will match if the message contains the trigger anywhere inside it
Will match as long as the message contains all the trigger's words in it, in the order that they were provided
Will match as long as the message contains all the trigger's words in it. The order the words appear in doesn't matter

description: There are multiple different types of response that you can set up for auto-responses. Each one responds in a different way.

rows: Wynem will reply with a regular Discord message
Will send an image, gif, or a video in chat
Reply with your own custom embed that can look however you want
Will send a message containing some clickable URL buttons
Will react to the message with some emoji reactions

tabs.name: Creating Auto-responses
content: To start setting up your own auto-responses, first run the e!addautoresponse/serverconfig autoresponses add command, and then click the button to start.

data.description: Press the button to start creating an auto-response

content:
Next, a modal will appear, where you can enter the information for the ID and trigger of the auto-response.
The ID is something for you to identify the auto-response by when viewing all auto-responses or trying to remove them.

data.title: Auto-response Builder
rows: The ID for you to identify the auto-response by
The text that will trigger the auto-response

content: You will then be given a choice of what trigger type the auto-response should use. Pick a type to continue.

data.description: What type of trigger would you like the auto-response to use?
fields: The entire message has to equal the trigger for it to respond
The message has to contain the trigger somewhere in it for it to respond
The words in the trigger are all required to be in the message, in the order provided. Other words can appear between them however
The words in the trigger are all required to be in the message. Other words can appear between them and their order does not matter

content: Next, you will get to choose what type of response will get sent when the trigger is fired. Choose the type to continue.

data.description: What type of auto-response would you like to create?
fields: Will send a regular Discord message
Will send an image/gif/video in chat
Will send a message containing some URL buttons
Will react to the message with some emoji reactions

tabs.name: Message
content: You will be presented with a button to add the auto-response's message. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the auto-response's message

content: A modal will appear where you can enter the message. Enter in your message and then submit it.

tabs.name: Image/Gif/Video
content: You will be presented with a button to add the auto-response's message. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the auto-response's image/gif/video

content: A modal will appear where you can enter the image/gif/video URL. Enter in your URL and then submit it.

tabs.name: Custom Embed
content: The custom embeds option will start the custom embed builder. For a guide on creating custom embeds, check out the Custom Embed feature.

tabs.name: URL Buttons
content: You will be presented with a button to add the auto-response's URL buttons. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the auto-response's URL buttons

content:
You will be able to add up to 25 buttons to your auto-response.
Buttons are special links that appear in a message.

There are 5 rows of buttons, which support up to 5 buttons each.
You must have at least 1 button on a row to have another row.
Skipping the first button in a row will skip all remaining buttons, whereas skipping any other button will skip the rest of the current row.

rows: The text that is displayed on the button
The URL to go to when you click on the button

data.title: URL Button Builder
rows: The URL to go to when clicking the button

content: After adding each button, you will be given the option to add the next button, skip the current row, or move to the next row. Choose what you want to do to continue.

data.description: Press a button to continue adding URL buttons

tabs.name: Emoji Reactions
content: You will be presented with a button to add the auto-response's resaction emojis. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the auto-response's reaction emojis

content: You will be able to add up to 5 emojis. You can provide either the emoji character, or the emoji name. If you use custom emojis, they can only be from the current server.
You are finished! Your auto-response has been created and is now active and ready for you to use!

tabs.name: Viewing Auto-responses
content: To view all the auto-responses currently active in the server, use the e!viewautoresponse/serverconfig autoresponses view command.

To view a specific auto-response, you can use the command e!viewautoresponse [autoresponse]. For example: e!viewautoresponse packdownload/serverconfig autoresponses view auto-response:[autoresponses]. For example: /serverconfig autoresponses view auto-response:packdownload.

buttons.label: All resource pack downloads can be found here

tabs.name: Removing Auto-responses
content: To remove an auto-response, start by running the command e!removeautoresponse [autoresponse]. For example: e!removeautoresponse packdownload/serverconfig autoresponses remove auto-response:[autoresponses]. For example: /serverconfig autoresponses remove auto-response:packdownload You will be prompted to confirm that you want to remove the auto-response. Press remove to continue.

data.description:
This action will remove the `packdownload` auto-response

Are you sure you want to continue?

content: After confirming, the auto-response will have been removed.
